page.title: 11S.ELKINGTON ADULT ACTIVITIES
page.content: {South Elkington Women's Institute} founded in 1946.This is a national organisation for women regardless of age,creed,colour,or politics.Monthly meetings in the village hall, attendance averaging thirty. Officers elected and subscriptions paid annually.Speakers and demonstrations cover a wide range of subjects. Some outdoor activities in summer,craft classes in winter,and members encouraged to take part in Group, County,and national events and to raise funds far charities. {Thursday Club}meets weekly in member's houses mainly for the benefit of pensioners who,without transport, are unable to join organisations in Louth. Activities include,speakers,table games,demonstrations,outings including visits to neighbouring clubs.One fund raising effort for charity annually.
